channel.title: Findings on Virginia Tech
channel.description: Recent content in Findings on Virginia Tech

item.title: Findings 1
item.description: Findings 1 Modeling Census Tract Level Evictions : Correlates Of Eviction Rates The following variables were significantly associated with census tract level evictions. Socio-demographic: Percentage of tract that is Black or African American (+), Percentage of tract aged 16+ who are unemployed (+), Census tract poverty rate (+), Percentage of tract with a bachelor’s degree (-), State Policy factors Number of exemptions to Fair Housing Laws (landlord friendly) (+), Number of exemptions landlords have from state landlord-tenant law (landlord friendly) (+), Number of legal remedies available to tenants (-), Number of total legal remedies available to landlords (-)

item.title: Findings 1
item.description: Findings 1 Modeling Census Tract Level Evictions : Correlates Of Eviction Rates The following variables were significantly associated with census tract level evictions. Socio-demographic: Percentage of tract that is Black or African American (+), Percentage of tract aged 16+ who are unemployed (+), Census tract poverty rate (+), Percentage of tract with a bachelor’s degree (-), State Policy factors Number of exemptions to Fair Housing Laws (landlord friendly) (+), Number of exemptions landlords have from state landlord-tenant law (landlord friendly) (+), Number of legal remedies available to tenants (-), Number of total legal remedies available to landlords (-)

item.title: Findings 2
item.description: Modeling Census Tract Level Evictions : Richmond: Visualizing An Index Of Eviction Intensity The Eviction Intensity Index we created from our regression model was used to rank all census tracts in U.S. cities that are comparable in size to Richmond in the United States. The wordcloud below visualizes the frequency that census tracts with the words “Richmond City” show up in a list of the top 320 most eviction intense tracts in the US.
